body:
Angular by default used PathLocationStrategy (without /#/).

If you provide 

providers: [{provide: LocationStrategy, useClass: HashLocationStrategy}]

somewhere in your code the router uses /#/.

This is usually done because when a server without HTML5 pushState support is used, PathLocationStrategy causes 404 errors. If your sever supports HTML5 pushState, just remove above provider.
title: Angular 2 Router 3.0.0 still displaying /#/ hash on route
